paper_metadata.title: Globally Rare BRCA2 Variants With Founder Haplotypes in the South African Population: Implications for Point-of-Care Testing Based on a Single-Institution BRCA1/2 Next-Generation Sequencing Study
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted BRCA2 variant information including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The deletion is predicted to cause loss of normal protein function through either protein truncation or nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.

functional_data.summary: The deletion is predicted to cause loss of normal protein function through either protein truncation or nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple cases.
variants.additional_notes: Most common pathogenic variant observed in both the Black and Coloured populations.
key_quotes: The deletion is predicted to cause loss of normal protein function through either protein truncation or nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.

patients.phenotype: Breast cancer, ovarian cancer, prostate cancer, pancreatic cancer

functional_data.summary: The variant is located in the gene’s helical domain responsible for binding single- and double-stranded DNA.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on genealogical and haplotype analysis.
key_quotes: The genealogical study involved 12 independent families linked to the variant, mapped over a minimum of 10 generations.

functional_data.summary: Confirmed as a new SA founder variant based on SNP haplotype analysis results.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on haplotype analysis.
key_quotes: This variant has not yet been included in the BRCA 1.0 POC Research Assay.

tables_processed.table_caption: Details of the most common BRCA2 pathogenic variants observed and their recurrence internationally.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted with detailed penetrance data.
